title: The One With The Metaphorical Tunnel

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's: everyone is there and they are watching an
info-mercial that stars Joey.]

dialogue.speaker: HOST
dialogue.text: Welcome everybody, welcome to Amazing Discoveries!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, oh! It's on again!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You guys, can we please not watch this all right.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Shhhh!

dialogue.speaker: HOST
dialogue.text: Folks, has this ever happened to you. You go to the refrigerator to get a nice glass of milk, (Joey is in the background struggling to open a cartoon of milk) and these darn cartons are so flingin'-flangin' hard to open.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (on tv) Oh, you said it Mike. (rips open the carton and spills milk on the counter) Aw! There's got to be a better way!

dialogue.speaker: MIKE
dialogue.text: And there is Kevin.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Can we please turn this off?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Noo way, Kevin.

dialogue.speaker: MIKE
dialogue.text: There is a revolutionary new product that guarantees that you'll never have to open up milk cartons again. Meet the Milk Master 2000.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Are you intrigued?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're flingin'-flangin' right I am!

dialogue.speaker: MIKE
dialogue.text: Keep in mind, he's never used this product before, you're gonna see how easy this is to do. (to Kevin) Go ahead. ('Kevin' starts using the product, it is a spout that you jab into a paper milk carton so that you don't have to rip it open.) This works with any milk carton.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (on TV, finishing installing the Milk Master 2000) Wow, it is easy. (starts to poor the milk) Now, I can have milk everyday.

scenes.location:
Monica and Rachel's: everyone is there and they are watching an
info-mercial that stars Joey.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's: everyone is there and they are watching an
info-mercial that stars Joey.]

events.event_description: The host welcomes the audience to Amazing Discoveries show.
Phoebe excitedly exclaims that the commercial is on again.
Joey expresses his desire for the group to stop watching the commercial.
The host describes the problem of opening milk cartons, with Joey struggling to open one in the background.
Joey on TV rips open a milk carton and spills milk on the counter.
Mike introduces the Milk Master 2000 as a revolutionary product to open milk cartons easily.
Mike demonstrates the use of the Milk Master 2000 with Kevin, showing how it attaches to a milk carton.
Kevin starts using the Milk Master 2000 on a milk carton during the commercial demonstration.
Joey on TV finishes installing the Milk Master 2000 and pours milk, expressing satisfaction with the product.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Janice are sitting on the couch, and Phoebe is
sitting next to them in the chair.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, it's official there are no good movies.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Well, let's go to a bad one and make out. (they start to kiss and lean back into Monica.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Perhaps, you would like me to turn like this, (turns sideways on the couch) so that you can bunny bump against my back.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, man. What's up?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Maybe you can tell me. My agent would like to know why I didn't show up at the audition I didn't know I had today. The first good thing she gets me in weeks. How could you not give me the message?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I'll tell ya I do enjoy guilt, but, ah, it wasn't me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, it was! It was him! Uh huh! (they all stare at her) Okay, it was me!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How is it you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, it was just, it was all so crazy, you know. I mean, Chandler was in the closet, counting to 10, and he was up to 7 and I hadn't found a place to hide yet. I-I-I meant to tell you, and I wrote it all down on my hand. See, all of it. (shows him her hand)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yep, that's my audition.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: See, now this is why I keep notepads everywhere.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yep, and that's why we don't invite you to play.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: What is the great tragedy here? You go get yourself another appointment.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, Estelle tried, you know. The casting director told her that I missed my chance.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That is unfair. I'll call her and tell her it was totally my fault.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Pheebs, you can't do that. The casting director doesn't talk to friends, she only talks to agents.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What a sad little life she must lead. Okay, ooh (starts dialing).

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What, what are you doing? What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, no, I know, I know, ooh. (on the phone in a different voice) 'Hi, this is Katelynn, from Phoebe Buffay's office. Um, is um, Ann there for Phoebe, she'll know what it's about.'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hang up, hang up. (reaches with his good arm, but Phoebe grabs it and he tries to reach the phone with his other arm but can't because of the sling.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (on phone) 'Annie! Hi. Listen we got a problem with Joey Tribbiani, apparently he missed his audition. Who did you speak to in my office? Estelle, no, I don't know what I'm going to do with her. No. All right, so your husband leaves and burns down the apartment, the world does not stop.'

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Is anybody else scared?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (on phone) 'Right, well look, um, if Joey loses this audition, that is it for Estelle. I don't care! Annie you are a doll, what time can you see him?' (to Monica) I need a pen. (Chandler hands her one, but she needs something to right on, so she tilts Chandler's head over and writes on the back of his neck)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Get the woman a pad! Get the woman a pad! A pad! A pad!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, now you want a pad.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Janice are sitting on the couch, and Phoebe is
sitting next to them in the chair.]

events.event_description: Janice suggests going to a bad movie and making out with Chandler, then leans back into Monica while they sit on the couch.
Monica turns sideways on the couch to demonstrate bunny bumping against her back.
Joey enters the scene and greets everyone.
Joey questions Chandler about missing an audition he was unaware of.
Phoebe claims Chandler was in the closet counting to 10 when she was hiding, and shows her hand with notes written on it.
Phoebe admits to Joey that she caused him to miss his audition.
Phoebe attempts to call Estelle to explain Joey's missed audition, using a fake caller ID from her office.
Phoebe writes on Chandler's neck with a pen while on the phone, seeking a pen to write on.
Chandler protests and demands a notepad when Phoebe tries to write on his neck.
Monica comments on Chandler's demand for a notepad after Phoebe's attempt to write on his neck.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are dropping off Ben]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL AND SUSAN
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: There's my boy! Here's my boy! And here's his Barbi (Ben is holding a Barbi doll) What's ah, what's my boy doing with a Barbi ?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: He picked it out of the toy store himself, he loves it.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: He carries it everywhere, it's like a security blanket, but with ski boots and a kicky beret.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's, it's, it's cute. Why, why, why does he have it, again?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: So he's got a doll? So what? Unless you're afraid he's gonna grow up and be in show business.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: This doesn't have anything to do with the fact that he is being raised by two women, does it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You know what it's fine. If you're okay with the Barbi thing, so am I.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Give daddy the Barbi ! Ben, give, give me the Barbi . Okay, how 'bout, don't you want to play with the monster truck? (makes a monster truck sound) No. Okay, oh, oh, how about a Dino-soilder? (squawks like a dinosaur)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, you are so pathetic. Why can't your son just play with his doll? (uses the Milk Master 2000 to pour milk into her cereal)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering from her bedroom) I gotta go to work. Has anybody seen my left boob?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I love that movie. (Joey is using it as a pillow)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: There it is. Joey, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, it just felt nice.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering with his ringing phone) Joe. Joe! Answer the phone.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, I only got one good arm, you know. You should be doing stuff for me. Go get me a sweater.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Just do it! Okay, it's Janice and if I get it I'm going to have to see her tonight. (phone stops ringing) Oh, that's great I'm gonna have to see her tonight.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What's the big deal? Why don't you wanna see Janice?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, last night at dinner, when the meals came, she put half her chicken piccata on my plate and took my tomatoes.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And that's bad because..., you hate chicken piccata?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Noo.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You didn't want to share your tomatoes, tomatoes are very important to you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, it's like all of the sudden, we were this couple. And this ala

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Men are unbelievable.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What is it with you people! I mean, the minute you start to feel something, you have to run away?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know, that, (looks at her fake chest, and loses his train of thought, temporarily) that's why I don't want to go tonight, I'm afraid I'm going to say something stupid.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, you mean like that guy thing where you act mean and distant until you get us to break up with you.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, you know about that?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look what do I do? I wanna get past this, I don't wanna be afraid of the commitment thing. I wanna go through the tunnel, to the other side!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Where there is no fear of commitment.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Do we have any...(turns around and bumps Monica's fake chest) Do we have any thoughts here?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I've never been through the tunnel myself, 'cause as I understand it, you're not allowed to go through with more than one girl in the car, right. But, it seems to me it's pretty much like anything else, you know, face your fear. It have a fear of heights, you go to the top of the building! If you're afraid of bugs.....get a bug. Right. In this case, you have a fear of commitment, so I say you go in there and be the most committed guy there ever was.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Amazingly, that makes sense.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You think?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. Go for it man, jump off the high dive, stare down the barrel of the gun, pee into the wind!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, Joe, I assure you if I'm staring down the barrel of a gun, I'm pretty much peeing every which way.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are dropping off Ben]

events.event_description: Carol and Susan enter Monica and Rachel's apartment.
Ross greets Ben and comments on him holding a Barbie doll.
Ross questions why Ben has a Barbie doll.
Carol explains that Ben chose the Barbie doll himself and loves it.
Susan describes Ben's attachment to the doll as a security blanket with accessories.
Ross questions why Ben has the doll again.
Rachel criticizes Ross for being pathetic about Ben's toy preferences.
Monica enters and asks about her left breast.
Joey uses Monica's breast as a pillow and explains he did so because it felt nice.
Chandler answers his ringing phone and discusses the possibility of seeing Janice that night.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe's beeper is going off]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's your audition from this morning. Can I use the phone again?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sure Pheebs, you know, that's what it's there for, emergencies and pretend agents.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on baby, come on!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (on phone, in 'Katelynn's' voice) 'Hi, I have Phoebe Buffay returning a page. Okay, well, um, she's in her car I'll have to patch you through.'

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Very nice touch.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (in voice, on phone) 'Okay, go ahead.' (in normal voice on phone) Um, hi Annie. (listens) Fantastic! (to Joey) You got it. (on phone) Oh, okay, um, 'Will he work for scale?' you ask me. Well, I don't know about that, (Joey clears his throat to signify yes) except that I do and he will. Great, oh you are such a sweetheart. I would love to have lunch with you, how about we have lunch next....(hangs up phone) Op, went through a tunnel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Unbelievable.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thank you so much.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It was really fun, I mean I've never talked on a car phone before.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You were amazing, could you just do me this huge favor, you see there's this one other audition that I really, really want, and Estelle couldn't get me in.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I don't know. I mean it was fun one time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on, please, it'll be just this one more, well actually it's two.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Two?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah! Well, well really it's three. Please. You're so good at it. I love you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, I'll do it, but just these three, right

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nooo, four.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe's beeper is going off]

events.event_description: Phoebe's beeper goes off, indicating a message or call.
Phoebe asks Rachel if she can use the phone again.
Phoebe makes a phone call using a fake voice to simulate an audition callback.
Phoebe informs Joey that she successfully patched through to the audition contact.
Phoebe hangs up the phone after the call goes through a tunnel.
Joey thanks Phoebe for her help with the phone call.
Joey requests Phoebe to make a second phone call for his audition, emphasizing its importance.
Phoebe hesitantly agrees to make the second call, setting a limit of three calls.
Joey insists on making a total of four calls for his auditions, despite Phoebe's hesitation.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Janice are having dinner]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: So, how come you wanted to eat in tonight?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: 'Cause, I wanted to uh, give you this. (hands her a present)

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Ohhh, are you a puppy! (opens it) Contact paper! I never really know what to say when someone you're sleeping with gives you contact paper.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, wait there's, there's more. See the contact paper is to go into your brand new drawer. (gives her a drawer) See, the drawer actually goes in my dresser.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh, you didn't have to do this.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, I did. Yes, I did. Because, you're my girlfriend, and that's what girlfriends should, should get.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Well, I gotta buy a vowel. Because, oh my Gawd! Who, would've thought that someday, Chandler Bing would buy me a drawer.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, not me. But that's what's happened, and, ah, and, and there's more. We should take a trip.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: We should?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yep, we're a couple and that's what couples do. And, I wanna meet your parents. We should take a trip with your parents!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (laughs) I don't think we need to, because you're tripping me out right now! Are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I am, I actually am. I mean this is amazing. My entire life I have feared this place, and now that I'm here it's like what was the big deal. I could probably say 'Let's move in together.' and I'd be okay.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: You probably want us to move in together?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It doesn't scare me!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, it scares me! I mean I not even divorced yet, Chandler. You know, you just invited me over here for pasta, and all of the sudden you're talking about moving in together. And, and I wasn't even that hungry. You know what, it's getting a little late, and I-I should just, um...(starts to leave)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, no, no, no, don't go! I've scared ya'! I've said too much! I'm hopeless, and awkward, and desperate for love!! (Janice leaves, Chandler then calls Janice to leave a message on her machine) Hey, Janice! It's me. Um, yeah, I-I-I just wanna apologize in advance for having chased you down the street. (runs out the door)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Janice are having dinner]

events.event_description: Chandler presents Janice with a wrapped gift, indicating a gesture of affection.
Janice opens the gift to find contact paper and comments on the awkwardness of receiving it from a romantic partner.
Chandler explains that the contact paper is for a new drawer in his dresser, giving her a drawer as a gift.
Chandler suggests taking a trip with Janice and her parents, expressing a desire to meet her family.
Janice reacts with laughter and questions Chandler's sudden proposal to move in together, expressing her discomfort.
Janice decides to leave the scene, citing her feelings of being overwhelmed and not being ready to move in together.
Chandler pleads with Janice not to leave, expressing his feelings of being hopeless, awkward, and desperate for love.
Janice exits the scene, and Chandler calls her voicemail to apologize for chasing her down the street.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are comforting Chandler]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, this will help. (hands him a tub of ice cream)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, I finally catch up to her and she says this relationship is going to fast and we have to slow down.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL AND MONICA
dialogue.text: Uff.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That is never good.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Then I got all needy and clingy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. Maybe it's not so bad. How did you leave it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She said she'd call me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL AND MONICA
dialogue.text: Ohh! (both grab there stomachs in pain)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh God.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Welcome to our side of the tunnel.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: This ice cream tastes like crap by the way.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, well that's that lo-cal, non dairy, soy milk junk. We sort of, we save the real stuff for those really terminal cases.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know, when you start get screwed over all the time, you gotta switch to low-fat.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, you do.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, you don't think I'm terminal?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, no, not at all, you're not terminal, you just, you just need some damage control.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, okay. So, should I call her?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL AND MONICA
dialogue.text: Nooo!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: This is a very critical time right now. If you feel yourself reaching for that phone, then you go shoe shopping, you get your butt in a bubble bath. You want her back you have to start acting aloof.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: She has to know that your not ready.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right. So, what you have to do is, you have to accidentally run into her on purpose. And then act aloof.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So I'm not, not gonna lose her?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oooh, honey, you're not a total loser.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I said, 'So I'm not gonna lose her?'

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are comforting Chandler]

events.event_description: Rachel hands Chandler a tub of ice cream to comfort him.
Chandler explains that his girlfriend said their relationship is moving too fast and they need to slow down.
Rachel and Monica express concern or sympathy with an 'Uff' and comment that this situation is not good.
Chandler admits he became needy and clingy after the breakup discussion.
Rachel asks Chandler how he left things with his girlfriend, and he responds that she said she would call him.
Rachel and Monica react with pain and discomfort upon hearing Chandler's update about his breakup.
Chandler comments that the ice cream tastes like crap, indicating his mood.
Rachel advises Chandler to avoid calling his ex-girlfriend and suggests engaging in activities like shoe shopping or taking a bubble bath to act aloof.
Monica suggests that Chandler needs to do damage control to show he's not ready to get back together.
Rachel instructs Chandler to intentionally run into his ex-girlfriend on purpose and act aloof to regain control of the situation.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is still trying to get Ben to play with something
other than the Barbi doll.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Guess who's here. It's the toughest guy in toy land, Ben. (singing) 'A real American hero. I'm G.I. Joe !' Drop the Barbi , drop the Barbi .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: G.I. Joe ? Do you really think he's gonna fall for that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering) G. I. Joe ! Cool! Can I play?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look Ben, it's a toy that protects U.S. oil interests overseas!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY AND ROSS
dialogue.text: Go Joe!!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Helloo! Oh! (sees Joey and starts to leave)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Pheebs! There you are!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No it's not, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: But Phoebe, wait! Wait! Phoebe. Phoebe! (catches her in the hallway)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, Joey! Oh, okay, see I didn't recognize you wearing, in those....pants.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look listen, that TV movie I went in for? Did you hear anything? I think I got a shot at it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes! They called and you didn't get it! Okay, I mean you didn't get it, I'm sorry, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It's okay, these things happen.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: But they shouldn't happen, you know what, you're, you're in a terrible, terrible business. Oh God, I don't wanna be the person who makes your face look like that.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm, I'm okay. See. (tries to smile, but fails horribly)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, now you're sad and creepy, oh. You know what, I, I'm sorry I quit, okay, I just quit.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No! No, no you can't quit! You're the best agent I ever had! Look Pheebs, rejection is part being an actor, you can't take it personally.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Not personal, really, well they said that they never met an Italian actor with a worse Italian accent.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: They actually said that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Ooh God, there's that face again! See I can't do this job! I...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, no, no, see that's why you have to do this job, agents always lie. You know, Estelle just says stuff like 'They went another way', but this, I can use this. (in a very bad Italian accent) I canna work on a new accent.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah okay, no if it helps you okay. Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (running into the hall, in slow motion) You'll never get me, Joe!!! (he then pretends that he gets shot repeatedly and falls back against Joey and Chandler's door, dead.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is still trying to get Ben to play with something
other than the Barbi doll.]

events.event_description: Ross introduces Ben as the toughest guy in toy land and sings a G.I. Joe song to him.
Ross encourages Ben to play with the G.I. Joe toy, implying it protects U.S. interests.
Joey enters and asks to play with the G.I. Joe toy.
Phoebe enters the scene and notices Joey, then starts to leave.
Joey catches Phoebe in the hallway and calls her back.
Phoebe comments on Joey's pants and Joey asks about a TV movie audition.
Phoebe informs Joey that he did not get the TV role he auditioned for.
Joey reassures Phoebe that rejection is part of acting and encourages her to continue as his agent.
Phoebe criticizes her own acting skills, mentioning her Italian accent.
Ross runs into the hall and pretends to be shot, falling against Joey and Chandler's door.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: A grocery store that Janice shops in. Chandler is on purpose, accidentally
bumping into her.]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (to butcher) No, thank you. (Chandler makes a sound and she notices him) Chandler!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (in a British accent) Hello, Janice.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: What are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (in accent) Oh, just a bit of shopping. How've you been?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Are you being British?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (normal voice) No. Not anymore.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Why are you shopping here? You don't live in this neighborhood. Were you here waiting for me?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, huh. I'm just uh, you know I'm just picking up some things for a party. (grabs a bag off of the shelf)

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Barley? What kind of party serves barley?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I'm sorry if my friends aren't as sophisticated as yours.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Where is this party?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Here in Chelsea.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Who's party is it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: A woman's

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: What woman?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (shyly) Chelsea.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Okay, you know, one of two things is happening here. Either you're seeing somebody behind my back, which would make you the biggest jerk on the planet. Or, else you're pretending that you're seeing somebody, which just makes you so pathetic that I could start crying right here in the cereal aisle. So like which of these two guys do you want to be? (another guy walks by)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Can I be that guy?

scenes.location: A grocery store that Janice shops in. Chandler is on purpose
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: A grocery store that Janice shops in. Chandler is on purpose, accidentally
bumping into her.]

events.event_description: Chandler intentionally bumps into Janice in the grocery store aisle.
Janice notices Chandler and greets him by name.
Chandler responds to Janice with a British accent and greets her.
Janice questions Chandler about his presence in the store.
Chandler claims he is shopping for a party and mentions Chelsea as the location.
Janice asks about the woman hosting the party, and Chandler confirms it is Chelsea.
Janice accuses Chandler of possibly seeing someone behind her back or pretending to do so, expressing her emotional distress.
Janice questions Chandler about his intentions, asking which role he wants to play.
Another man walks by as Janice confronts Chandler.
Chandler humorously asks to be the man Janice is accusing him of seeing.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are there]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, so we got some more good rejections, lots of stuff to work on.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, shoot.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, um, oh, the zoo commercial.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I didn't get it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No. They said you 'Weren't believable as a human being.' So, you can work on that.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, what else?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, the off-Broadway play people said 'You were pretty but dumb.'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no wait, I'm sorry, that's 'pretty dumb.'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, it's okay, no, no, no, really, look um, I really appreciate this Pheebs, but I think I'm gonna have to go back to Estelle.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, well don't get me wrong, you're a better agent than she is, but at least with her I don't want to blow my pretty dumb brains out.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, no, I understand.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You do, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Sorry. (she starts to leave)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wait a minute.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, did you just make up all that stuff just to get out of being my agent.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (in a coy tone) Oh, you caught me. I am so busted.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (in a really, really bad Italian accent) That's-ah what I suspected-ah.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are there]

events.event_description: Phoebe informs Joey about the negative feedback he received for the zoo commercial and the off-Broadway play.
Joey asks Phoebe if she got the zoo commercial, and Phoebe confirms he was not cast.
Phoebe tells Joey that the casting directors said he 'Weren't believable as a human being.'
Phoebe reports that the off-Broadway play directors said Joey was 'pretty but dumb.'
Joey expresses his intention to return to Estelle as his agent.
Joey comments that he prefers Estelle because she doesn't make him want to 'blow his pretty dumb brains out.'
Phoebe reacts with understanding to Joey's decision to leave her agency.
Joey questions whether Phoebe fabricated the negative feedback to avoid being his agent.
Phoebe coyly admits she made up the negative feedback to get out of being Joey's agent.
Joey humorously suspects Phoebe's deception in an exaggerated Italian accent.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is laying on the counter and Rachel and Monica
are comforting him again.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ....And then I just, you know, threw the bag of barley at her, and ran out of the store.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: My God! Chandler, we said be 'aloof' not 'a doof'.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I've actually ruined this haven't I? It's time for the good ice cream now, right?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, it is.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know what, everything's gonna be okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (answering phone) Hello. Hi, Janice! Can you hold on for a second? Okay. (to Monica and Rachel) Okay, what do I do?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Shhh...I don't know what to do, this is totally unprecedented.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: If-if-if we ever did what you did a man would never call.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hello!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh wait, you know what, I got it, I got it, pretend like you just woke up, okay, that will throw her off. Be sleepy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, and grumpy.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you, stop naming dwarves! (on phone) Hello, Janice. Hi, I'm so glad that you called, I know I've been acting a really weird lately. And, it's just because I'm crazy about you, and I just got...stupid, and, and scared, and....stupid a couple of more times. I'm sorry. (listens) Really?! (listens) Really?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: He's soo lucky, if Janice were a guy, she'd be sleeping with somebody else by now.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (on phone) I love you too.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Aw, it's soo unfair. (they both start digging into the 'good' ice cream)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is laying on the counter and Rachel and Monica
are comforting him again.]

events.event_description: Chandler recounts throwing a bag of barley at someone and running out of the store.
Monica jokes that Chandler was supposed to be 'aloof' but said 'a doof'.
Chandler questions if he has ruined his situation and mentions wanting ice cream.
Rachel agrees that it is time for ice cream.
Monica offers reassurance that everything will be okay.
Chandler answers a phone call from Janice and asks Monica and Rachel what to do.
Monica suggests Chandler pretend to be sleepy to throw Janice off.
Rachel suggests Chandler pretend to be grumpy during the call.
Chandler, on the phone, admits to Janice that he's been acting weird because he's crazy about her and feels scared.
Chandler expresses love to Janice during the call.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are picking up Ben, while Monica is
pouring chocolate syrup, lots of it, into her ice cream.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: G. I. Joe. G. I. Joe ?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, I don't know what to tell you guys that's the doll he chose.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: What'd you do, dip it in sugar?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, G. I. Joe 's in, Barbi 's out. And if you guys can't deal with it, that's your 'too bad.'

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What are you being such a weenie for? So he has a Barbi, big deal. You used to dress up like a woman.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, you used to dress up in Mom's clothes all the time.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: The big hat, the pearls, the little pick handbag.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, you are totally making this up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How can you not remember? You made us call you...Bea.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (remembering) Oh God.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: I've literally never been this happy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wasn't there a little song?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh please God, let there be a song.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: There was no song. (to Monica) There was no song!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (singing) ' I am Bea. '

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ' I drink tea. '

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, that's, that's enough. (retreats to the bathroom)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: '.... Won't you, won't you, won't you .... '

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (coming out of the bathroom) Won't you dance around with me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: A-ha!!! (they all start laughing, as Ross hides in the bathroom)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are picking up Ben, while Monica is
pouring chocolate syrup, lots of it, into her ice cream.]

events.event_description: Carol and Susan arrive at Monica and Rachel's to pick up Ben.
Monica pours a large amount of chocolate syrup into her ice cream.
Ross defends his choice of G.I. Joe doll, stating it was Ben's decision.
Ross claims that Barbie dolls are out and G.I. Joe dolls are in.
Monica mocks Ross for dressing up like a woman when he was a child.
Ross denies remembering dressing up in his mother's clothes and being called Bea.
Monica sings a song about being Bea, implying Ross's childhood behavior.
Ross reacts with embarrassment and retreats to the bathroom.
Monica continues singing the song about Bea, teasing Ross.
Ross exits the bathroom, protests that there was no song, and the group starts laughing.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: It's an old home movie of the Geller's backyard, young Ross is dressed up as
Bea, and pouring himself/herself some tea.]

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG ROSS
dialogue.text: (singing) 'I am Bea. I drink tea. Won't you dance around with....' (spills some tea and it drips onto his/her dress) Ohhh! (runs away crying)

dialogue.speaker: YOUNG MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering the shot) Ross!!! (starts to wipe up the spill)

scenes.location: It's an old home movie of the Geller's backyard
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: It's an old home movie of the Geller's backyard, young Ross is dressed up as
Bea, and pouring himself/herself some tea.]

events.event_description: Young Ross dressed as Bea pours himself/herself some tea in the backyard.
Young Ross sings a song about being Bea and drinking tea.
Young Ross spills tea onto his/her dress while singing.
Young Ross reacts to spilling tea by exclaiming 'Ohhh!' and runs away crying.
Young Monica enters the backyard scene and notices the spilled tea.
Young Monica starts to wipe up the tea spill on the ground.
